text: Heliocheilus julia is a North American moth. It is in the family Noctuidae. Heliocheilus julia is attracted to lights. Its life history and host plants are unknown.Jerry A. Powell and Paul A. Opler (2009). Moths of Western North America. University of California Press, Berkeley and Los Angeles, CA. ==Distribution== Heliocheilus julia is found from central New Mexico west to eastern Arizona and south to Jalisco, Mexico. ==Flight period== This moth has one brood. It is seen from late July to September. ==References== Category:Noctuidae
title: Heliocheilus julia
